title: How to learn to build a house - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, I built my own house. Here’s how I learned: Start by thinking you know more than you actually do and wait until you’re in way too far over your head before you realize it. That way there is no backing out. You’re either going to learn or go bankrupt. It’s great motivation!!Don’t keep close track of your costs and be wildly optimistic about how much the whole thing is going to cost. You’ll quickly find out how much your relatives love you when you hit them up for thousands of dollars.Hire people solely based on cost to save money. Learn valuable skills as you re-do the work of incompetent people. That whole quality thing is totally overrated!!And finally, learn from all your horrible mistakes. In the end you will have your home and you will have gained some valuable expertise in the process. Hey, it worked for me!

If you don't have a pretty good idea of the answer already it is most probably that you cannot. Those of us who could have spent a lot of time learning about the process and could not have done so (at least not well) when we were first starting out. The only way is to to learn a whole lot about it as well as what parts you don't want to learn and will job out to experts (such as plumbing and wiring). Keep in mind that building a house well requires experts in numerous trades each of which takes a long time to learn and years to master.

Building a house is the best thing I ever did. Having read Thoraeu, I sold all investments and assets and built a house. My goal was to build a house without a mortgage. I researched all of the alternative methods of steel, foam blocks, straw….etc., and settled on conventional wood frame because there were so many examples of construction for me to investigate when I got stuck. I got into good shape and I no reason to watch TV or go to the movies because my life was exciting every single day! It took me 5 years until we were finished.

You mean with your own two hands? I’m going to assume you mean the best plan of attack for hiring someone to build your house… Make sure you check on the progress often. Catch mistakes before they get too big. Learn what you can live with and what you can live without. The costs add up quickly. Plan for delays, changes, and extras. I know I want a home theater, so we built that into the original house plan.

There are many options. What you should investigate first is what your municipal code includes or excludes. Then go through Youtube and look at various options, strawbale, cob construction, ram earth, shipping containers. The most acceptable to municipalities are factory built homes. You could ask them to deliver it occupancy ready but not finished and save your self a few bucks if you do the finishing work. Good luck
